intro: Orlaya daucoides, commonly known as the common orlaya, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial shade to full sun. Its flowers are often visited by pollinators such as bees and flies, contributing to its ecological significance. Orlaya daucoides is also known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
